title: CVE-2022-42915: HTTP proxy double-free

profile.name: curl
profile.about: cURL is an Open Source project providing a library and command-line tool for doing internet transfers

vulnerability_information:
This is a finding that Trail of Bits found in their ongoing curl security audit. Reported at a status meeting today.

## Summary:

curl frees memory twice in some cleanup function related to HTTP proxies.

It as simple as `curl -x http://localhost:80 dict://127.0.0.1`

Using valgrind on the current git master, it shows:

==55921== Copyright (C) 2002-2022, and GNU GPL'd, by Julian Seward et al.
==55921== Using Valgrind-3.19.0 and LibVEX; rerun with -h for copyright info

==55921== Parent PID: 3035
==55921==

==55921==    at 0x484617B: free (vg_replace_malloc.c:872)

## Impact

Double-free is nasty

activities.message:
1. Fun fact: a reproducer can be as  short as `curl -x 0:80 dict://0` if you run a HTTP proxy on port 80.
2. I could easily write a test case for this problem to both reproduce the problem and verify my fix. See pending patch.

Hackerone gave me an error instead of CVE when I requested one just now. I've filed a support issue.

Meanwhile, I attach my advisory draft without CVE for now.
Still no response from hackerone support on why we can't get a CVE for this.

Thanks for your work. The actual monetary reward part for this issue is managed by the [Internet Bug Bounty](https://hackerone.com/ibb) so the curl project itself therefor sets the reward amount to **zero USD**. If you haven't already, please submit your reward request to them and refer back to this issue.
There will be no reward for this issue since it was reported as part of a (paid) security audit.
